intro: Voacanga foetida, commonly known as the stinking evergreen or African locust bean, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody pods containing elongated, hard seeds that are used in traditional medicine. Its latex contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful if ingested. Despite its noxious odor, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has cultural significance in some regions.
